contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} The '''America All Party Parliamentary Group''' is a cross-party group consisting of members of the [[Parliament of the United Kingdom]], whose purpose is 'to prompt friendly relations and mutual understanding between members of the [[United States Congress]] and [[Member of Parliament#United Kingdom|Members of Parliament]]; to arrange for the exchange of visits and information; and to provide opportunities for discussion'.<ref name="register">[http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm/cmallparty/register/america.htm Register of All-Party Groups: British-American Parliamentary Group]</ref> Its co-presidents are the Speaker of the House of Commons and the Lord Speaker, among the vice presidents are former Speakers of the House of Commons, one former prime minister, the current deputy prime minister, former leaders of the opposition, and former foreign secretaries. The chairman is the prime minister. ==Officers== {{update|date=November 2010}} ===Joint Presidents=== *The Rt Hon [[John Bercow]] - [[Speaker of the House of Commons (United Kingdom)|Speaker of the House of Commons]] *The Rt Hon [[Baroness D'Souza]] -
